title: Troubleshooting Valve Issues Using A Voltmeter

tasks.task: Troubleshoot a malfunctioning sprinkler system zone.
subtasks: Identify the type of issue (zone not stopping, not coming on, or not coming on at all) to determine the possible cause.
Check if it's a valve issue by observing the sprinklers' behavior.
Use a voltmeter to test the controller's voltage output to the affected zone's solenoid.
Verify common wire connection at the controller.
Check for continuity (resistance) between the solenoid terminals and probes to assess the solenoid and wiring.
If necessary, check the valve's solenoid and wiring at the valve box.
Determine if the problem is caused by a faulty valve, wiring, or controller and replace the faulty components as needed.
